A friend of mine just sent some photos of a leather nagamaki tsuba from his collection.  I put them up at:

http://tinyurl.com/d2ee

His description:

"Attached are the pix of that leather nagamaki tsuba I was telling you about.  It is 3.5  inches in diameter and .25 inches thick.  It is made from two pieces of leather and it appears that there may be a fabric covering under the lacquer..you can see a weave looking design on the edges where the lacquer is cracked away.  This particular tsuba fit on the pole about a foot behind the blade.  There is a four pointed iron guard device that goes in front of it.  I don't have the whole pole, but I do have all the forward parts."

Jim
